story.kicker_image_caption: Yogender Shukla, an east Delhi-based insurance agent, received mixed response from clients on govt schemes.
story.storykicker: "Mostly people of lower income group have shown interest towards such policies. People belonging to the middle income group are not bothered to enquire about such schemes," he said.
story.storybody:
Yogender Shukla, an east Delhi-based insurance agent, has hundreds of customers who have taken different insurance policies from him. When asked about various insurance policies launched by the government in the past two years, under the financial inclusion scheme, he said there are mixed responses from people on those policies. "Mostly people of lower income group have shown interest towards such policies. People belonging to the middle income group are not bothered to enquire about such schemes," he said.

Speaking further, he said that it is not that people are not aware about such schemes. "People know very well about all these schemes. But, they are not interested mainly because of the lower amount these policies offer. People know about the value of Rs 2 lakh in coming years. Most of the policies offer lower sum of money on maturity," he added. On Atal Pension Yojna,

Shukla said that this policy is good for people of the lower income group as an 18-year-old can invest as low as Rs 42 per month to get a monthly pension of Rs 4,000-Rs 5,000 per month. "But, generally people think about the money. What would be the value of Rs 5,000 in a month after 20 years. This is the reason, people are not showing interest towards this scheme," he added.

Bank officials stated similar situations towards such schemes. Like Shukla, they also said that there are hundreds of policies offered by different companies, but, some of these schemes, including Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Yojna, Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojna have received good responses from people of lower income group.
story.magazinekicker: "Mostly people of lower income group have shown interest towards such policies. People belonging to the middle income group are not bothered to enquire about such schemes," he said.
story.shortheadline: People not keen as policies offer low maturity amount: An insurance agent

People of lower income group show interest in govt insurance schemes
